senses.de: To prevent something or make it more difficult
senses.ex: Heavy rains hampered the relief efforts.

Tips.title: Imply Obstruction
Tips.description: Use 'hamper' when something slows down progress or creates obstacles, not just any difficulty.
Tips.example: The lack of funding hampered the new school's construction.

Tips.title: Negative Situations
Tips.description: Hamper is used in negative contexts, suggesting problems or challenges.
Tips.example: The constant interruptions hampered her ability to concentrate.

Tips.title: Active Hindrance
Tips.description: 'Hamper' implies an active hindrance rather than a passive one.
Tips.example: The bad weather didn't just complicate the trip; it actively hampered our plans.

senses.de: A basket with a lid, used usually for carrying food, often in a picnic
senses.ex: She packed a picnic hamper with sandwiches and fruit.

Tips.title: Carrying Food
Tips.description: Remember 'hamper' as a noun usually refers to a basket for carrying meals, especially outdoors.
Tips.example: Don't forget to bring the hamper for our beach picnic.

Tips.title: Traditional Picnics
Tips.description: A 'hamper' often implies a traditional or old-fashioned style picnic.
Tips.example: Their picnic hamper was filled with homemade bread and jars of pickles.

Tips.title: With a Lid
Tips.description: A 'hamper' typically has a lid which makes it differ from an open-top basket.
Tips.example: She secured the lid on the hamper before setting off on her hike.

Block.wordDefinition:
Block means to obstruct or stop something from moving forward or progressing. For example, a roadblock can block the path of a car.

In short, while block refers to complete obstruction, hamper refers to an obstacle that makes something more difficult.

Cripple.wordDefinition:
Cripple is often used to describe a person or thing that has been significantly disabled or rendered incapable.

It can be perceived as a derogatory or offensive term when applied to a person with a physical or mental disability. Examples might include "his injury will cripple his ability to play sports," or "the company's poor financial decisions will cripple its growth.".

Cripple implies a significant and often permanent disabling of something or someone, whereas hamper only suggests a temporary or partial obstacle.

Encumber.wordDefinition:
Both encumber and hamper mean to hinder or impede progress.

However, encumber specifically refers to something that is a burden or obstacle, such as a heavy backpack encumbering a hiker's movement.

In other words, encumber is more about weight or burden, while hamper is more about physical limitation.

Hinder.wordDefinition:
Hinder means to make it difficult for someone or something to do something or to prevent it from happening altogether.

For example, if you cut someone's internet connection, you are hindering their ability to access online resources.

Both words imply a sense of obstacle or obstruction, but hamper refers to something that slows down progress or movement, while hinder implies something that actively prevents or makes it difficult to do something.

Impede.wordDefinition:
Impede on the other hand, means to prevent or obstruct progress or movement entirely.

For example, a roadblock on the highway would impede traffic entirely, preventing people from getting to their destination.

Inhibit.wordDefinition:
Inhibit means to prevent or restrain someone or something from taking action. It implies more of a mental or psychological block or restriction, like feeling shy or timid that could inhibit your ability to speak up in public or socialize effectively.

Hamper refers to physical obstructions, while inhibit refers to mental/intellectual restrictions.

Interfere.wordDefinition:
Both hamper and interfere relate to obstacles that get in the way of something.

Interfere means to get in the way of or prevent someone or something from completing a task properly. It's usually used when someone or something is causing a problem, like a meddling person who interferes with a business deal.

Hamper refers to physical obstructions, while interfere refers to difficulties caused by people or things getting in the way.

Obstruct.wordDefinition:
Obstruct means to block or hinder completely, so that no progress can be made.

It is often used in legal or political contexts, such as if someone tries to obstruct justice by lying to investigators.

It can also refer to physical blockages, such as when a fallen tree obstructs a road and prevents cars from passing through.

Hamper is used when something is causing a delay or making progress slower, whereas obstruct refers to a complete blockage that prevents any progress at all.

Restrain.wordDefinition:
Restrain denotes the act of holding back or preventing someone or something from doing something.

For example, if a person was becoming agitated and violent, their doctor might need to restrain them to prevent harm to themselves or others.

Hamper means to limit progress or success, while restrain means to hold back or prevent something from happening entirely.

quotes.Text: Especially during the hot weather, we have been so greatly hampered by infections despite our utmost care, and since we have lost so many dogs, I strongly desire more help to keep the place clean and gloves and gowns and a thorough fitting up of our operating room.
quotes.Title: Canadian Scientist
quotes.Name: Frederick Banting

quotes.Text: Death is really a great blessing for humanity, without it there could be no real progress. People who lived for ever would not only hamper and discourage the young, but they would themselves lack sufficient stimulus to be creative.
quotes.Title: Austrian Psychologist
quotes.Name: Alfred Adler

quotes.Text: You don't want to take the world over with a whole hamper full of dirty clothes. That's the main thing people overlook. And take a shower, take a bath every day.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: J. B. Smoove

quotes.Text: Those who seek to satisfy the mind of man by hampering it with ceremonies and music and affecting charity and devotion have lost their original nature.
quotes.Title: Chinese Philosopher
quotes.Name: Zhuangzi

quotes.Text: It is not wealth one asks for, but just enough to preserve one's dignity, to work unhampered, to be generous, frank and independent.
quotes.Title: British Playwright
quotes.Name: W. Somerset Maugham

quotes.Text: I'm determined not to lose my name. It's who I am. It has neither aided my progress nor hampered it. It's just who I am.
quotes.Title: Welsh Actor
quotes.Name: Ioan Gruffudd

quotes.Text: Marriage, for a woman at least, hampers the two things that made life to me glorious - friendship and learning.
quotes.Title: English Writer
quotes.Name: Jane Harrison

quotes.Text: Every day, new laws are created that further hamper the ways children can engage with the world.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Gever Tulley

quotes.Text: You can't run a business based on sympathies; otherwise our business would be hampered.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Marc Rich

quotes.Text: I don't want to get someone in my life who is going to hamper my state of mind.
quotes.Name: Shamita Shetty
